Colossians__04.1: Masters, do to your servants that which is just and equal: knowing that you also have a master in heaven.
Colossians__04.2: Be instant in prayer; watching in it with thanksgiving:
Colossians__04.3: Praying withal for us also, that God may open unto us a door of speech to speak the mystery of Christ (for which also I am bound;)
Colossians__04.4: That I may make it manifest as I ought to speak.
Colossians__04.5: Walk with wisdom towards them that are without, redeeming the time.
Colossians__04.6: Let your speech be always in grace seasoned with salt: that you may know how you ought to answer every man.
Colossians__04.7: All the things that concern me, Tychicus, our dearest brother, and faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, will make known to you,
Colossians__04.8: Whom I have sent to you for this same purpose, that he may know the things that concern you, and comfort your hearts,
Colossians__04.9: With Onesimus, a most beloved and faithful brother, who is one of you. All things that are done here, they shall make known to you.
Colossians__04.10: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, saluteth you, and Mark, the cousin german of Barnabus, touching whom you have received commandments; if he come unto you, receive him:
Colossians__04.11: And Jesus, that is called Justus: who are of the circumcision: these only are my helpers in the kingdom of God; who have been a comfort to me.
Colossians__04.12: Epaphras saluteth you, who is one of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, who is always solicitous for you in prayers, that you may stand perfect, and full in all the will of God.
Colossians__04.13: For I bear him testimony that he hath much labour for you, and for them that are at Laodicea, and them at Hierapolis.
Colossians__04.14: Luke, the most dear physician, saluteth you: and Demas.
Colossians__04.15: Salute the brethren who are at Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church that is in his house.
Colossians__04.16: And when this epistle shall have been read with you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans: and that you <u>read that which is of the Laodiceans</u>.
Colossians__04.17: And say to Archippus: Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfill it.
Colossians__04.18: The salutation of Paul with my own hand. Be mindful of my bands. Grace be with you. Amen.
